Superstar teacher toolbox

Additional information and resources Digital safety Accessibility & inclusion Digital competences AI & analytics Digital pedagogy theory

Useful sources

Digital Culture Network provides guidance on how to make digital content accessible to all audiences: Digital Culture Network. (n.d.). How to Make Your Online Content Accessible.

A guide on inclusive teaching, learning and assessment, detailing why it is important and with tips on how to enhance inclusivity in your classroom: Inclusion in education: UCL. (2020, April 27). Inclusive teaching, learning and assessment.

A comprehensive checklist for creating accessible digital content, including guidelines on high contrast colours, not using color alone to convey information, providing text alternatives for images, using structure with headings, lists, and captions: https://accessibility.princeton.edu/checklist.

Accessibility check if you cannot do a detailed one provides guidance on evaluating accessibility in your organization: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications
